crossreferences.comment: Cross References Sample 1 crosref1.sfm Nov 97 Updated April 24, 2003; July 14, 2003 Converted to XML 5 November 2004. Arranged according to the order of books in the Bible In this file "(space)--(space)" represents a long dash. It will need to be changed before printing. The following cross reference file was adapted by Sandra Callister from Mufian cross-references (Conrad). Double checked by Steve Christensen. (i)The main criteria was to put in as few cross references as possible to prevent cluttering the page and/or confusing the mind of the reader by presenting too many ideas, and to consider those which were thought to be most relevant and helpful, e.g. if a cross reference was only verbally similar to the verse it referred to, but not pertinent to the main idea of the verse, then the cross reference was deleted. (ii) Where the cross reference was within the same chapter as the verse it referred to, this also was deleted on the expectation that the context of the verse would be read. (iii) Where the same idea was expressed in parallel passages from two or three of the gospels, usually only one was chosen to be used as the cross reference. (iv) The majority of cross references given in the TEV New Testament were retained, except where the cross reference was already included in the parallel passages cited at the beginning of each section in the gospels. Please note the order of the cross references for a particular verse is not necessarily the order in which the books occur in the bible. The more salient references are placed first. Use the changes table cros-nam.cct Nov 97 to convert to the abbreviation of book names which you are using. In the change table put the abbreviation you are using between double quote marks on the right-hand side. This change table does not change the book name for backslash @, that is, the verse being referenced. This will be deleted by the typesetter during typesetting. For these, only the reference, not the book name is printed in the NT. Where in your translation you have combined two verses together, you may want to combine the corresponding cross references together. However this is not necessary. You may also want to check the spanned verses here, that they do not run contrary to how your NT has its verses setup. English book abbreviations used here are taken from NIV Study Bible. Corrections and comments are welcomed.
